title: Refraction - rank index of refraction of lenses

content.question: Which of the following correctly ranks the indices of refractions of the lenses?

choices.label: <math alttext="n sub 1 equals, n sub 2, which equals n sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="n sub 2 is greater than n sub 1, which is greater than n sub 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="n sub 3 is greater than n sub 1, which is greater than n sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="n sub 3 is greater than n sub 2, which is greater than n sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="n sub 2 is greater than n sub 1, which is greater than n sub 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
